page.title: 11Crafton and its environs
page.content: With the death of Lord Rosebery and the subsequent sale of the estate, the {Stud Farm}was purchased merely as a home and not as a going concern. There is no longer a stud farm here, nor indeed are there any horses, just a few cattle. The Land is let for grazing.{The Thatched Barns,}formerly used as fodder storage, are now converted into houses and are being sold on the open market. They are still thatched and timbered in construction, but their continued existance will be far removed from past uses. The village will gain more residents, but many of them will be commuters and not involved with the land or local industry. However there are still some farm workers resident in Crafton.{Crafton Lodge }is the former gamekeeper's cottage and this year has become a listed building.
